SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A VARY OF INFORMATION TO THE PERSON

ANSWERING THE QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces.

The sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the question, please turn over.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1947, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in the province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Write answers to questions, or descriptive paragraphs where, if they help to answer.

The sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the question, please turn over.

This questionnaire applies to pioneers living in Western Canada. Be answered this, and could be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).
